availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Davis McHenry (Ohio Co. state rep & senator)

body.p: Hartford, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Hartford native. Son of John Hardin McHenry. Graduated from law school at Transylvania University in 1845. Married Jennie Taylor McHenry on January 26, 1856. Attorney in Hartford in 1845. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1851 to 1853. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1861 to 1865.

bibl.p: C.J. Norwood, Inspector, Legislative Document No. 18. Eight Annual Report of the Inspector of Mines of the State of Kentucky, October 10th, 1891 (Frankfort: Capital Office, E. Polk Johnson, Public Printer and Binder, 1891), 244. Memorial Addresses on the Life and Character of Henry Davis McHenry, (Delegate from Ohio County), Delivered in the Constitutional Convention of Kentucky, January 7th, 1891 (Frankfort: Capital Office, E. Polk Johnson, Public Printer and Binder, 1891). "McHENRY, Henry Davis" in Biographical Directory of the United States Congress, http://bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=M000468 (accessed May 19, 2017).
